channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: The FBI seizure of Georgia 2020 election ballots relies on debunked claims
item.description: An FBI investigation of the 2020 election in Fulton County, Ga., was initiated by a lawyer who aided President Trump's unsuccessful efforts to overturn that election, an unsealed affidavit says.
item.content:encoded:
An FBI investigation of the 2020 election in Fulton County, Ga., was initiated by a lawyer who aided President Trump's unsuccessful efforts to overturn that election, an unsealed affidavit says.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Federal judge acknowledges 'abusive workplace' in court order
item.description: The order did not identify the judge in question but two sources familiar with the process told NPR it is U.S. District Judge Lydia Kay Griggsby, a Biden appointee.
item.content:encoded:
The order did not identify the judge in question but two sources familiar with the process told NPR it is U.S. District Judge Lydia Kay Griggsby, a Biden appointee.

(Image credit: Steve Helber)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Top 5 takeaways from the House immigration oversight hearing
item.description: The hearing underscored how deeply divided Republicans and Democrats remain on top-level changes to immigration enforcement in the wake of the shootings of two U.S. citizens.
item.content:encoded:
The hearing underscored how deeply divided Republicans and Democrats remain on top-level changes to immigration enforcement in the wake of the shootings of two U.S. citizens.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Snowboarder Chloe Kim is chasing an Olympic gold three-peat with a torn labrum
item.description: At 25, Chloe Kim could become the first halfpipe snowboarder to win three consecutive Olympic golds.
item.content:encoded:
At 25, Chloe Kim could become the first halfpipe snowboarder to win three consecutive Olympic golds.

(Image credit: Lindsey Wasson)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Pakistan-Afghanistan border closures paralyze trade along a key route
item.description: Trucks have been stuck at the closed border since October. Both countries are facing economic losses with no end in sight. The Taliban also banned all Pakistani pharmaceutical imports to Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
Trucks have been stuck at the closed border since October. Both countries are facing economic losses with no end in sight. The Taliban also banned all Pakistani pharmaceutical imports to Afghanistan.

(Image credit: ABDUL MAJEED)
item.dc:creator: Betsy Joles

item.title: Malinowski concedes to Mejia in Democratic House special primary in New Jersey
item.description: With the race still too close to call, former congressman Tom Malinowski conceded to challenger Analilia Mejia in a Democratic primary to replace the seat vacated by New Jersey Gov. Mikie Sherrill.
item.content:encoded:
With the race still too close to call, former congressman Tom Malinowski conceded to challenger Analilia Mejia in a Democratic primary to replace the seat vacated by New Jersey Gov. Mikie Sherrill.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: A daughter reexamines her own family story in 'The Mixed Marriage Project'
item.description: Dorothy Roberts' parents, a white anthropologist and a Black woman from Jamaica, spent years interviewing interracial couples in Chicago. Her memoir draws from their records.
item.content:encoded:
Dorothy Roberts' parents, a white anthropologist and a Black woman from Jamaica, spent years interviewing interracial couples in Chicago. Her memoir draws from their records.

(Image credit: Cris Crisman)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: A person has been detained for questioning in Nancy Guthrie disappearance, sheriff says
item.description: The Pima County Sheriff's Department said a "subject" was detained during a traffic stop south of Tucson, Ariz., hours after authorities released images of a potential suspect.
item.content:encoded:
The Pima County Sheriff's Department said a "subject" was detained during a traffic stop south of Tucson, Ariz., hours after authorities released images of a potential suspect.

(Image credit: Ty ONeil)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Reporter's notebook: A Dutch speedskater and a U.S. influencer walk into a bar â€¦
item.description: NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Rachel Treisman took a pause from watching figure skaters break records to see speed skaters break records. Plus, the surreal experience of watching backflip artist Ilia Malinin.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: In Beirut, Lebanon's cats of war find peace on university campus
item.description: The American University of Beirut has long been a haven for cats abandoned in times if war or crisis, but in recent years the feline population has grown dramatically.
item.content:encoded:
The American University of Beirut has long been a haven for cats abandoned in times if war or crisis, but in recent years the feline population has grown dramatically.

(Image credit: Tamara Saade for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf
